description: Comprehensive test data for Bosniak CT classification of cystic renal lesions covering all categories (I, II, IIF, III, IV) with edge cases

testCases.name: Classic Bosniak I - Simple Benign Cyst

expectedOutputs.management: Simple, benign cyst - No follow up needed

testCases.clinicalContext: Homogeneous water attenuation cyst with imperceptible thin wall, no septa, calcifications, or solid components. Benign finding requiring no follow-up.

testCases.name: Bosniak II - Few Thin Septa

expectedOutputs.management: Minimally complex benign cyst - No follow up needed

testCases.clinicalContext: Minimally complex cyst with few hairline thin septa. No enhancement. Benign, no follow-up needed.

testCases.name: Bosniak II - Fine Peripheral Calcifications

expectedOutputs.management: Minimally complex benign cyst - No follow up needed

testCases.clinicalContext: Water density cyst with fine peripheral or septal calcifications. Benign appearance.

testCases.name: Bosniak IIF - Minimally Thick Walls
testCases.clinicalContext: Cyst with minimally thickened smooth wall. Minimal enhancement possible. Requires imaging follow-up.

testCases.name: Bosniak IIF - Thick Minimally Enhanced Septa
testCases.clinicalContext: Cyst with thick or minimally thickened septa showing minimal enhancement. Follow-up imaging recommended.

testCases.name: Bosniak IIF - High Attenuation Cyst (>20 HU)
testCases.clinicalContext: Homogeneous mass with high attenuation >20 HU at unenhanced CT (≥70 HU typical). May represent proteinaceous or hemorrhagic cyst. Requires follow-up.

testCases.name: Bosniak IIF - Totally Intrarenal Cyst
testCases.clinicalContext: Simple cyst that is totally intrarenal. This location alone upgrades to IIF requiring follow-up.

testCases.name: Bosniak IIF - Large Cyst (≥3 cm)
testCases.clinicalContext: Simple cyst measuring ≥3 cm. Size alone warrants follow-up imaging to ensure stability.

testCases.name: Bosniak IIF - Multiple IIF Features
testCases.clinicalContext: Cyst with multiple IIF features: minimally thick walls, thick septa, high attenuation, intrarenal location, and large size. Still IIF (not upgraded to III without irregular enhancement).

testCases.name: Bosniak III - Thickened Irregular Enhancing Walls
testCases.clinicalContext: Cyst with thickened irregular walls showing measurable enhancement. Indeterminate mass requiring surgical exploration.

testCases.name: Bosniak III - Thickened Irregular Enhancing Septa
testCases.clinicalContext: Cyst with thickened irregular enhancing septa. Indeterminate lesion requiring surgical resection.

testCases.name: Bosniak III - Thick Nodular Calcifications
testCases.clinicalContext: Cyst with thick or nodular calcifications. These calcifications suggest possible malignancy, requiring surgical resection.

testCases.name: Bosniak III - Multiple Concerning Features
testCases.clinicalContext: Cyst with multiple Category III features: thick irregular walls, irregular septa, and thick nodular calcifications. Highly concerning for malignancy.

testCases.name: Bosniak IV - Enhancing Soft Tissue Component

expectedOutputs.management: Clearly malignant cystic mass - Surgical resection

testCases.clinicalContext: Cyst with enhancing soft tissue component. Clearly malignant cystic mass (likely cystic RCC). Requires surgical resection.

testCases.name: Bosniak IV - Soft Tissue Overrides All Other Features

expectedOutputs.management: Clearly malignant cystic mass - Surgical resection

testCases.clinicalContext: Cyst with soft tissue component and all possible concerning features. Soft tissue enhancement alone determines Category IV classification regardless of other features.

testCases.name: Edge Case - Category III Overrides IIF Features
testCases.clinicalContext: Mix of IIF features (minimally thick walls, fine calcs, high density, intrarenal, large) and Category III feature (irregular septa). Category III wins.

testCases.name: Edge Case - Borderline Category II vs IIF

expectedOutputs.management: Minimally complex benign cyst - No follow up needed

testCases.clinicalContext: Cyst with both thin septa and fine calcifications. Both are Category II features. Remains Category II (no IIF features present).

I.criteria: Water attenuation, thin wall, no septa, calcifications, or solid components

II.criteria: Few thin septa, fine calcifications, or minimally complex features without enhancement

IIF.criteria: Minimally thickened walls/septa with minimal enhancement, high attenuation, intrarenal location, or ≥3cm size
IIF.management: Follow-up imaging at 6 and 12 months, then yearly for 5 years

III.criteria: Thickened irregular walls or septa with measurable enhancement, thick/nodular calcifications

references.citation: Bosniak MA. The current radiological approach to renal cysts. Radiology. 2005 Jul;236(1):61-70.
references.description: Original Bosniak classification system for cystic renal lesions on CT

references.citation: Silverman SG, Pedrosa I, Ellis JH, et al. Bosniak Classification of Cystic Renal Masses, Version 2019: An Update Proposal and Needs Assessment. Radiology. 2019 Aug;292(2):441-448.
references.description: Updated Bosniak classification including MRI criteria

notes.mriNote: This calculator implements the CT-based Bosniak 2005 classification. For MRI evaluation, use the updated Bosniak 2019 MRI criteria (Silverman et al. Radiology 2019).
notes.highAttenuationNote: A homogeneous mass ≥70 HU at unenhanced CT is consistent with a high-attenuation renal cyst
notes.textModuleNote: Text module generation is only implemented for Category I cases in current version
